lines: Towards the end of my Rice career, I was considering pursuing a career in STEM education.
So, during my junior summer I decided to work at a technology summer camp for middle and elementary school students.
I taught a different tech course each week to groups of approximately 16 campers.
Over the course of the summer, I helped students learn Python, Lua, and Scratch.
My campers particularly enjoyed building command-line apps like simple calculators and text-based games.
I was most impressed with my studentsâ€™ confidence and creativity while coding despite being relatively new to STEM.
